00017  *          to create the new problem (shallow copy).

00019  *  @param  old_problem [in] the problem to apply the function to

00175 /**
00176  *  @brief  Concorde userdat structure for basic cost matrix function.
00177  */
00178 typedef struct basic_data
00179 {
00180     CCdatagroup *dat;   /**< existing Concorde data structure */
00181     int delta;          /**< delta value */
00182 } basic_data;
00183 
00184 /**
00185  *  @brief  Concorde userdat structure for constrained cost matrix function.
00186  */
00187 typedef struct constrained_data
00188 {
00189     CCdatagroup *dat;   /**< existing Concorde data structure */
00190     int infinity;       /**< value to use for "infinity" */
00191     int delta;          /**< delta value */
00192 } constrained_data;
00193 
00194 /**
00195  *  @brief  Concorde userdat structure for constrained shake cost matrix
00196  *          function.
00197  */
00198 typedef struct constrained_shake_data
00199 {
00200     arrow_problem *problem;     /**< original problem data */
00201     arrow_problem_info *info;   /**< original problem info */
00202     int rand_min;               /**< smallest random number to generate */
00203     int rand_max;               /**< largest random number to generate */
00204     int random_list_length;     /**< the number of random numbers in list */
00205     int infinity;               /**< value to use for "infinity" */
00206 } constrained_shake_data;

00209 /****************************************************************************
00210  * Public function implemenations
00211  ****************************************************************************/
00212 int
00213 arrow_btsp_fun_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00214                      int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00215 {
00216     CCutil_init_datagroup(&(new_problem->data));
00217     new_problem->size = old_problem->size;
00218     sprintf(new_problem->name, "%s", old_problem->name);
00219     new_problem->shallow = fun->shallow;
00220     new_problem->get_cost = old_problem->get_cost;
00221     
00222     if(!fun->shallow)
00223     {
00224         /* Create structure to hold new cost matrix */
00225         int ret;
00226         ret = arrow_util_CCdatagroup_init_matrix(old_problem->size, 
00227                                                  &(new_problem->data));
00228         if(ret != ARROW_SUCCESS)
00229             return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00230     }
00231     
00232     /* Apply the function to the cost matrix */
00233     if(!fun->apply(fun, old_problem, delta, new_problem))
00234     {
00235         arrow_print_error("Could not apply cost matrix function.");
00236         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00237     }
00238     
00239     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00240 }
00241 
00242 void
00243 arrow_btsp_fun_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00244 {
00245     fun->destruct(fun);
00246 }
00247 
00248 int
00249 arrow_btsp_fun_basic(int shallow, arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00250 {
00251     fun->data = NULL;
00252     if(shallow)
00253     {
00254         fun->shallow = ARROW_TRUE;
00255         fun->apply = basic_shallow_apply;
00256     }
00257     else
00258     {
00259         fun->shallow = ARROW_FALSE;
00260         fun->apply = basic_deep_apply;
00261     }
00262     fun->feasible_length = 0;
00263     fun->destruct = basic_destruct;
00264     fun->feasible = basic_feasible;
00265     
00266     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00267 }
00268 
00269 int
00270 arrow_btsp_fun_basic_atsp(int shallow, arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00271 {
00272     if(shallow)
00273     {
00274         arrow_print_error("Not supported.\n");
00275         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00276     }
00277     else
00278     {
00279         fun->shallow = ARROW_FALSE;
00280         fun->apply = basic_atsp_deep_apply;
00281     }
00282 
00283     fun->feasible_length = 0;
00284     fun->destruct = basic_atsp_destruct;
00285     fun->feasible = basic_atsp_feasible;
00286 
00287     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00288 }
00289 
00290 int
00291 arrow_btsp_fun_constrained(int shallow, double feasible_length, int infinity, 
00292                            arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00293 {
00294     if((fun->data = malloc(sizeof(int))) == NULL)
00295     {
00296         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for fun->data (int).");
00297         return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00298     }
00299     *((int*)fun->data) = infinity;
00300     
00301     if(shallow)
00302     {
00303         fun->shallow = ARROW_TRUE;
00304         fun->apply = constrained_shallow_apply;
00305     }
00306     else
00307     {
00308         fun->shallow = ARROW_FALSE;
00309         fun->apply = constrained_deep_apply;
00310     }
00311     fun->feasible_length = feasible_length;
00312     fun->destruct = constrained_destruct;
00313     fun->feasible = basic_feasible;
00314     
00315     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00316 }
00317 
00318 int
00319 arrow_btsp_fun_constrained_shake(int shallow, double feasible_length, 
00320                                  int infinity, int rand_min, int rand_max,
00321                                  arrow_problem *problem, 
00322                                  arrow_problem_info *info, 
00323                                  arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00324 {
00325     if(shallow)
00326     {
00327         arrow_print_error("Not supported.\n");
00328         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00329     }
00330     else
00331     {
00332         fun->shallow = ARROW_FALSE;
00333         fun->apply = constrained_shake_deep_apply;
00334     }
00335     
00336     /* Create data structure for function */
00337     constrained_shake_data *data;
00338     if((fun->data = malloc(sizeof(constrained_shake_data))) == NULL)
00339     {
00340         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for fun->data.");
00341         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00342     }
00343     data = (constrained_shake_data *)(fun->data);
00344     
00345     /* Set structure parameters */
00346     data->problem = problem;
00347     data->info = info;
00348     data->rand_min = rand_min;
00349     data->rand_max = rand_max;
00350     data->infinity = infinity;
00351     
00352     fun->feasible_length = feasible_length;
00353     fun->destruct = constrained_shake_destruct;
00354     fun->feasible = constrained_shake_feasible;
00355     
00356     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00357 }

00360 /****************************************************************************
00361  * Private function implemenations
00362  ****************************************************************************/
00363 int
00364 basic_shallow_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem,
00365                     int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00366 {
00367     CCdatagroup *old_data = &(old_problem->data);
00368     CCdatagroup *new_data = &(new_problem->data);
00369     basic_data *user;
00370     
00371     if((new_data->userdat.data = malloc(sizeof(basic_data))) == NULL)
00372     {
00373         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for basic_data.");
00374         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00375     }
00376     user = (basic_data *)(new_data->userdat.data);
00377     user->dat = old_data;
00378     user->delta = delta;
00379         
00380     new_data->userdat.edgelen = basic_edgelen;
00381     CCutil_dat_setnorm(new_data, CC_USER);
00382     
00383     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00384 }
00385 
00386 int
00387 basic_deep_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem,
00388                  int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00389 {
00390     int i, j, cost;
00391     for(i = 0; i < new_problem->size; i++)
00392     {
00393         for(j = 0; j <= i; j++)
00394         {
00395             cost = old_problem->get_cost(old_problem, i, j);
00396             new_problem->data.adj[i][j] = (cost <= delta ? 0 : cost);
00397         }
00398     }
00399     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00400 }
00401 
00402 void
00403 basic_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00404 { }
00405 
00406 int
00407 basic_feasible(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *problem, 
00408                int delta, double tour_length, int *tour)
00409 {
00410     return (tour_length <= fun->feasible_length ? ARROW_TRUE : ARROW_FALSE);
00411 }
00412 
00413 static int 
00414 basic_edgelen(int i, int j, struct CCdatagroup *dat)
00415 {
00416     basic_data *user = (basic_data *)(dat->userdat.data);
00417     int old_cost = user->dat->edgelen(i, j, user->dat);
00418     return (old_cost <= user->delta ? 0 : old_cost);
00419 }
00420 
00421 int
00422 basic_atsp_deep_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem,
00423                       int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00424 {
00425     int i, j, cost;
00426     for(i = 0; i < new_problem->size; i++)
00427     {
00428         for(j = 0; j <= i; j++)
00429         {
00430             cost = old_problem->get_cost(old_problem, i, j);
00431             
00432             if((cost >= 0) && (cost <= delta))
00433                 new_problem->data.adj[i][j] = 0;
00434             else
00435                 new_problem->data.adj[i][j] = cost;
00436         }
00437     }
00438     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00439 }
00440 
00441 void
00442 basic_atsp_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00443 { }
00444 
00445 int
00446 basic_atsp_feasible(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *problem, 
00447                     int delta, double tour_length, int *tour)
00448 {
00449     int i, u, v, cost;
00450     int trans_edges = 0;
00451     
00452     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00453     {
00454         u = tour[i];
00455         v = tour[(i + 1) % problem->size];
00456         cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, v);
00457         
00458         if(cost > delta)
00459             return ARROW_FALSE;
00460             
00461         if(cost < 0)
00462             trans_edges++;
00463     }
00464     
00465     
00466     /* If an edge's cost is strictly less than 0, then it was introduced into
00467        the transformation from asymmetric to symmetric.  Any tour we find must
00468        use each of these edges in order for the tour to be valid. */
00469     if(trans_edges == (problem->size / 2))
00470         return ARROW_TRUE;
00471     else
00472         return ARROW_FALSE;
00473 }
00474 
00475 int
00476 constrained_shallow_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem,
00477                           int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00478 {
00479     CCdatagroup *old_data = &(old_problem->data);
00480     CCdatagroup *new_data = &(new_problem->data);
00481     constrained_data *user;
00482     
00483     if((new_data->userdat.data = malloc(sizeof(constrained_data))) == NULL)
00484     {
00485         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for constrained_data.");
00486         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00487     }
00488     user = (constrained_data *)(new_data->userdat.data);
00489     user->dat = old_data;
00490     user->delta = delta;
00491     user->infinity = *((int*)(fun->data));
00492     
00493     new_data->userdat.edgelen = constrained_edgelen;
00494     CCutil_dat_setnorm(new_data, CC_USER);
00495     
00496     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00497 }
00498 
00499 int
00500 constrained_deep_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem,
00501                        int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00502 {
00503     int i, j, cost;
00504     int infinity = *((int*)(fun->data));
00505     for(i = 0; i < new_problem->size; i++)
00506     {
00507         for(j = 0; j <= i; j++)
00508         {
00509             cost = old_problem->get_cost(old_problem, i, j);
00510             new_problem->data.adj[i][j] = (cost <= delta ? cost : infinity);
00511         }
00512     }
00513 
00514     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00515 }
00516 
00517 void
00518 constrained_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00519 { 
00520     if((int*)(fun->data) != NULL)
00521     {
00522         free((int*)(fun->data));
00523         fun->data = NULL;
00524     }
00525 }
00526 
00527 static int 
00528 constrained_edgelen(int i, int j, struct CCdatagroup *dat)
00529 {
00530     constrained_data *user = (constrained_data *)(dat->userdat.data);
00531     int old_cost = user->dat->edgelen(i, j, user->dat);
00532     return (old_cost <= user->delta ? old_cost : user->infinity);
00533 }
00534 
00535 int
00536 constrained_shake_deep_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem,
00537                              int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00538 {
00539     int i, j, cost, rand_val, pos;
00540     int *rand_list;
00541     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00542     arrow_bintree tree;
00543     
00544     constrained_shake_data *data = (constrained_shake_data *)(fun->data);
00545     int list_length = data->info->cost_list_length;
00546     
00547     /* Generate an ordered list of random numbers */
00548     arrow_bintree_init(&tree);
00549     while(tree.size < list_length)
00550     {
00551         rand_val = arrow_util_random_between(data->rand_min, data->rand_max);
00552         arrow_bintree_insert(&tree, rand_val);
00553     }
00554     if(!arrow_bintree_to_array(&tree, &rand_list))
00555     {
00556         arrow_print_error("Could not transform tree into int array");
00557         arrow_bintree_destruct(&tree);
00558         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00559     }
00560             
00561     /* Fill cost matrix */
00562     for(i = 0; i < new_problem->size; i++)
00563     {
00564         for(j = 0; j <= i; j++)
00565         {
00566             cost = old_problem->get_cost(old_problem, i, j);
00567             if(i == j)
00568             {
00569                 new_problem->data.adj[i][j] = 0;
00570             }
00571             else if(cost <= delta)
00572             {
00573                 if(!arrow_util_binary_search(data->info->cost_list, 
00574                                              list_length, cost, &pos))
00575                 {
00576                     arrow_print_error("Could not find cost in cost list!");
00577                     ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00578                     goto CLEANUP;
00579                 }
00580                 rand_val = rand_list[pos];
00581                 new_problem->data.adj[i][j] = cost + rand_val;
00582             }
00583             else
00584             {
00585                 new_problem->data.adj[i][j] = data->infinity;
00586             }
00587         }
00588     }
00589 
00590 CLEANUP:
00591     arrow_bintree_destruct(&tree);
00592     free(rand_list);
00593     return ret;
00594 }
00595 
00596 void
00597 constrained_shake_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00598 { 
00599     if((constrained_shake_data *)(fun->data) != NULL)
00600     {
00601         free(fun->data);
00602         fun->data = NULL;
00603     }
00604 }
00605 
00606 int
00607 constrained_shake_feasible(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *problem, 
00608                            int delta, double tour_length, int *tour)
00609 {
00610     int i, u, v, cost;
00611     arrow_problem *old_problem = 
00612         ((constrained_shake_data *)(fun->data))->problem;
00613     double actual_length = 0.0;
00614     for(i = 0; i < old_problem->size; i++)
00615     {
00616         u = tour[i];
00617         v = tour[(i + 1) % old_problem->size];
00618         cost = old_problem->get_cost(old_problem, u, v);
00619         
00620         if(cost > delta)
00621             return ARROW_FALSE;
00622         
00623         actual_length += cost;
00624         if(actual_length > fun->feasible_length)
00625             return ARROW_FALSE;
00626     }
00627     
00628     return ARROW_TRUE;
00629 }
